subNodes.conversationText: root
[The battle is over, but it has taken some time for Ianth to recover...]|***ga_fade_from_black-->Float::6 |
[Finally, she turns to you.] Oh, , there is no help for this sorrow, is there? It is true, what he said. He never felt anything for me--he never pretended to, he never could have!--And yet--

Marcellus lives, but he lives as a murderer.  In war, men often kill for money.  But to watch with coldness the murder of a priest in his own home, to see him hacked apart with a cleaver... |***gc_global_int-->NOT::False    String::marcellus_lives    String::1    |

Oh Sune!  Is this why you have shown me no sign?  Because I loved someone so vile?  Because my love was false, wasted on someone who never showed me any sign of love?  But don't you teach us  that love is always good and beautiful?
[More quietly.] If that is true, perhaps I never loved. Perhaps love is, as the unfaithful say, a lie. No! It cannot be--but perhaps, whatever it is, it is not for me.

Ianth, you must listen to me. Whoever Marcellus is or was does not change that whatever you felt for him was real. If there was truth in what you felt, it does not become a lie now.|***ga_global_int-->String::moral String::++ |
I thank you for those words, <FirstName>.  I trust you.  We have been through much together, and I--|***gc_global_int-->NOT::False    String::ianth_romance    String::1    |
--I--think that the solace you give me--It--Oh, by Sune.  So little makes sense to me right now.
[Recovering her composure quickly.] Let us go on.
I thank you for those words, <FirstName>.  I trust you.  We have been through much together, and you have become a true friend.
Do not say such things, Ianth.  You cannot help what you felt.  Just because Marcellus turned out to be a bad person doesn't mean you aren't fit to love someone else.
I don't know what to say, Ianth, except that I am here for you.
[Nod.] It is it time for you to move on, Ianth.

Am I to expect cold words even from you, who have been so kind to me?|***gc_global_int-->NOT::False    String::ianth_romance    String::1    ***gc_global_int-->NOT::False    String::ianth_inf    String::>5    |
[Recovering her composure quickly.] You are, in any case, right for the moment.
We need to get back to Drawn Swords and tell Hamfast all that has happened here--and bid him farewell.  If the Cyricists want us, as they appear to, we should probably leave the area soon.
|***ga_journal-->String::Q_MANFRED    Int::80    Int::0    Int::0    Int::0    |
I suppose I should have expected such words from you.
Dead!  The one I loved for so long--and by our hand.  And yet he deserved to die.  To watch the murder of a priest in his own home, to see him hacked apart with a cleaver...Sune!
